topics.title: Functional Components
topics.content: The design of components that make up the building blocks of React applications. They allow independent and reuseable UI features.

topics.title: Component Basics
topics.content: Encompasses Javascript XML (JSX), when to use properties vs state, the requirements of conditional rendering, and component composition to abstract complexity and reinforce the DRY principle.

topics.title: Rendering
topics.content: The virtual DOM (VDOM) is an important aspect of how React works. It is a lightweight in-memory representation of the DOM (Document Object Model), and it is used to optimize the rendering of components in a React application. React uses a diffing algorithm to efficiently update the underlying DOM.

topics.title: Basic Hooks
topics.content: Allow the user to use React's features, like managing your component's state and or performing an after effect when certain changes occur in state(s) without writing a class.

topics.title: Custom Hooks
topics.content: Reusable logic extracted into a custom hook.
